title: 112_s3077
content: The Act is titled the "Pro Football Hall of Fame Commemorative Coin Act" and includes findings. The Pro Football Hall of Fame's mission is to honor individuals who have made outstanding contributions to professional football, preserve historic documents and artifacts, educate the public about the sport's origin and growth, and promote its positive values. The Hall of Fame opened on September 7, 1963 with a charter class of 17 players. The Pro Football Hall of Fame, established on September 7, 1963, inducted a charter class of 17 players, coaches, and contributors including legends like Sammy Baugh, Red Grange, and Jim Thorpe. There have been 273 members elected to the Hall of Fame, each recognized by a bronze bust, a gold jacket, and a ring. The Hall has welcomed nearly 9 million visitors since its opening. The Pro Football Hall of Fame has welcomed nearly 9 million visitors since opening in 1963. The museum has expanded multiple times and now houses the world's largest collection on professional football, including over 20,000 artifacts and 20 million pages of documents. The Pro Football Hall of Fame has nearly 3,000,000 photographic images and reaches a worldwide audience of nearly 15,000,000 people annually through various channels. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue $5 gold coins weighing 8.359 grams, with a diameter of 0.850 inches, and containing 90% gold and 10% alloy. Additionally, $1 silver coins will be minted weighing 26.73 grams, with a diameter of 1.500 inches, and containing 90% silver and 10% copper. Half-dollar clad coins minted under this Act contain 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper, weigh 11.34 grams, have a diameter of 1.205 inches, and are legal tender. Coins minted under this Act are considered numismatic items for purposes of section 5134 of title 31, United States Code. SEC. 4. DESIGN OF COINS. The design of the coins minted under this Act shall be emblematic of professional football, with inscriptions including the coin's value, the year 2016, and words like "Liberty" and "In God We Trust". The design will be selected by the Secretary after consultation. The design of the coins minted under this Act shall be emblematic of professional football and selected by the Secretary after consultation with relevant organizations, and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility for a one-year period starting on January 1, 2016. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted before issuance. The coins minted under this Act will be sold at a reasonable discount for prepaid orders before issuance. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. All sales of coins issued under this Act include surcharges of $35 per $5 coin, $10 per $1 coin, and $5 per half-dollar coin. Surcharges received are promptly paid to the Pro Football Hall of Fame for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame is subject to audits. The Pro Football Hall of Fame receives surcharges from coin sales for construction and renovation. The Hall of Fame is subject to audits as per the requirements of the United States Code. There is a limitation on the number of commemorative coin programs issued annually. The Secretary of the Treasury may issue guidance to carry out the provisions of the United States Code.
